page.title: 15Bannachra Castle Arden
page.content: The ruins of Bannachra Castle can be seen in the garden of Bannachra House. It was built in the sixteenth century by the Colquhouns because the Macgregors and Macfarlanes were fighting against them. The castle looks right up Glen Fruin and the River Fruin is like a moat on one side of it. Sir Humphrey Colquhoun was killed in the castle in 1592 by a poisoned arrow. The castle was destroyed at the time of the Battle of Glen Fruin in 1603. In a field below the castle there is a cairn which marks the spot where some boys are said to be buried. They had come out from Dumbarton to see the battle.
